fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44207].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
In a few aspects of JIRA e.g. User Profile menu (my JIRA home, logout menu items), the atl_token is appended to the URL and propagated using GET method.

_Sensitive information such as token will travel as part of URL when using GET. This information will be stored in browser cache and server logs. This information will be available for unauthorized disclosure through various methods such as shoulder surfing, shared machines or accessing server logs. Additionally, URLs information can get leaked out using referrer header when an external link is accessed via the application._

h3. Suggested Solution
POST method can be used instead, since it doesn't store the token as part of the URL and perhaps appears to expose less.
fields.summary: atl_token appended to request URL

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44195].
  {panel}

I often have meetings relating to this or that JIRA Task, Story, Epic, etc.,  I keep track of the meeting and follow-ups in Confluence, creating Confluence tasks as I go.  Often these tasks relate directly to a JIRA ticket.  It would be very convenient to have an easy way to view all Confluence tasks that relate to this or that JIRA ticket within said ticket (rather than creating a link manually in the Confluence document, and then clicking on the resulting link in JIRA to see if there were any tasks that relate to the JIRA ticket).

Maybe this could involve a specialized Confluence Macro, identifying a JIRA ticket that will display all the tasks in the Confluence page (with the ability to check said tasks in the JIRA ticket), as well as link type in JIRA that would identify individual Confluence records whose tasks will be brought into the JIRA ticket.

Finally, it would be good to have a separate area for Confluence tasks within the JIRA ticket - maybe something like the areas for the lists of linked tickets and sub-tasks that are currently found in JIRA tickets.

I created a ticket in the Confluence project for this functionality -  [https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-38209] for this functionality.

Thanks,

Daniel.
fields.summary: Allow for the inclusion of Confluence Tasks within a JIRA ticket

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44193].
  {panel}

As a PO, I want to easily collect suggestions from my products' sales & support personnel to have feedback from people working "in the trenches".


Although plain JIRA can be shoehorned into a suggestions management system, the result is nowhere near as convenient as the solution proposed on your [HipChat support page|https://help.hipchat.com/forums/138883-suggestions-ideas].

I don't need a solution as comprehensive as one would get by having the UserVoice/Plugin/JIRA bundle (I could not justify the cost for an internal use), but something that would give me:
* An issue collector gadget with search box & instant results (to avoid duplications)
* A workflow add-on (to get a quick-start)
* An economic voting system (with votes returning once the suggestion is closed)
* linked-issues triggers (ability to transition one issue based on a transition from a linked issue)

Would be just good enough.
fields.summary: As a PO I want to easily collect suggestions from my products' sales & support personnel

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44191].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
JIRA hangs when Edit button is clicked. This happens when all fields are removed from the Edit Screen. 


h3. Environment
* Delete all fields from Edit Screen
* !screen1.png|thumbnail!


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new project
# Go to the project's project administration page > Screens > Click on Edit Issue Screen
# Remove all fields from Edit Issue screen
# Create issue from this project
# Click on Edit button


h3. Expected Results
# Have the same behavior as if the user has no edit permissions in the project permission scheme: No EDIT button and nothing if we use the 'e' shortcut

h3. Actual Results
# Loading icon shows non stop 
!screen2.png|thumbnail!

h3.Workaround
Hit the *Esc* button from the keyboard
fields.summary: Edit button causes JIRA to hang when Edit issue screen does not contain any field

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44190].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

We have certain situations where opening up a new issue can only happen if it is linked to a previous issue (things like tuning). I know the linking issue is optional but have the ability to make it required would be beneficial.
  
h3. Suggested Solution

Have a feature where Administrator will be able to define if Issue Linking is mandatory for certain issue type in a project.
fields.summary: Making Linking an issue mandatory

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44186].
  {panel}

Hi,

Currently, sub-tasks can only be filtered by 'Show Open' or 'Show All'. I would like to request that we can filter the tasks if a string in the sub-task title matches the filter.

For example, where I work, I work on tickets for fixing website bugs. This part of the QA process. There's a master ticket labelled "Client Name QA", and then there are sub-tasks for each QA bug.

The sub tasks are named with their relevant department, and the issue, like so:

PM - blah blah
CSS - Blah blah
Dev - Blah Blah

Me, handling tasks for CSS, would only like to see the ones relevant to me, so I think it would be beneficial that I could only show subtasks which have CSS in the title.

So the logical way of seeing it would be something like: If 'title' contains 'CSS', display, else hide. I know it's not that simple, but that's where I'm getting at!

Thanks in advance guys,
Ash
fields.summary: Add feature to filter sub-tasks by title

Currently, the new Pie Chart graphics hides elements in the "Other" category if there are too many sections on the pie chart. Example: 
!PieChartExpand.png|thumbnail!
You would have to hover your mouse over it to show the other elements. 

We should have an Expand feature where clicking on the "Other" element would *expand* the list and show all values, instead of having it as a popup panel. This allows people to screenshot the *entire table* and put it in their own reports.

h3. Description
On the issue links at JIRA, it shows "Mentioned In" and it lists the Confluence page. However, if the Confluence page has a workflow associated,  JIRA will not show the page current status.
See the screenshot attached for reference.

h3. Suggestion
JIRA could be able to retrieve the Confluence page status and show there, like it does with other JIRA issues.
fields.summary: Show Confluence page status when linked to JIRA issue

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44166].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Description

Formatting is changed the moment the user paste on IE 10 and above. 

h3. Steps to Replicate

# Create a description with the following format (verified from the database):
{code}
 \r
 \r
 Test Issue,\r
 \r
 Check if the return carriage is taking effect.\r
 \r
 Especially using IE 10\r
 \r
 Check\r
{code}
# Copy from the description field
# Paste it to the comment box at the comment field
# Click Save

h3. Expected Behavior

Retain the formatting

h3. Actual Behavior

It is saved with:
{noformat}
 Test Issue,\r
 Check if the return carriage is taking effect.\r
 Especially using IE 10\r
 Check\r
{noformat}
(i) You will notice during the pasting, the carriage return (\r) is removed 

h3. Additional Information

There are cases, where the carriage return is removed entirely. And return as:
{noformat}
Test Issue, Check if the return carriage is taking effect. Especially using IE 10 Check
{noformat}
(i) However, this cannot be reproduce reliably using VMAC
fields.summary: Pasting Text In IE10 Removes the Carriage Return

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44131].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
In JIRA Administration (the cog) > System > User Interface: Default User Preferences there is the option to increase the number of issues displayed per Issue Navigator page when viewing Issues in the Issue Navigator. Since JIRA 6.4.x, there is now a limit to the number of Projects that can be viewed in Projects > View All Projects at a time. This limit is currently set to 25.


h3. Suggested Solution
Just as we allow the JIRA Administrator to increase the number of Issues that can be viewed at a time in the Issue Navigator for their users, there should also be an ability to increase the number of Projects that can be viewed in View All Projects.

 
h3. Workaround 
There isn't a way to increase this number at the moment.
fields.summary: Increase Number of Projects Displayed

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44113].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
The field in the Assign Issue dialog allows for either typing to immediately select somebody, or clicking on the down arrow to scroll through a list of all the users on an instance. If you have enough users on your instance that the dropdown list has a scrollbar, if you scroll to the bottom JIRA appears to query itself for the list of assignable users multiple times, and you end up with duplicate users appearing at the bottom of the list.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create 15-20 users in JIRA 6.5-OD-07, ensure all of them are able to be assigned issues (you need enough users to cause the user list in the Assign Issue dialog to have to scroll).
# Create a new JIRA issue.
# Click Assign, then hit the dropdown arrow in the Assignee field.
# Scroll down (using the keyboard or trackpad/mouse, it doesn't matter) to the bottom of the list.

h3. Expected Results
You reach the bottom of the user list and there's no duplicates.

h3. Actual Results
As you get to the bottom of the user list, you'll notice the scrollbar will jump and you'll have a couple of duplicate users appearing at the bottom. This will repeat two or three more times.
 
h3. Notes
You can see the XHRs appearing in the web inspector each time the scrollbar jump happens. The very first XHR when you click the down arrow in the Assignee field will contain all the users with no duplicates, but the subsequent ones will have only one or two users in them, which are the duplicates that appear at the bottom of the list upon scrolling down.

This isn't browser-specific (I can replicate it in Firefox, Chrome, and Safari).

h3.Workaround
Currently there's no workaround, but this issue is purely cosmetic.
fields.summary: Scrolling down list of users in the "Assign Issue" dialog results in duplicate users appearing

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

h3. Suggested Solution

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44109].
  {panel}

If an issue is being viewed in SD, the URL might be something like:

https://jdog.jira-dev.com/servicedesk/agent/GROW/queues/136/GROW-2037

When some attachment options are selected (like change the sort or the view) we are redirected to JIRA, URL something like:

https://jdog.jira-dev.com/browse/GROW-2037?attachmentViewMode=list#attachmentmodule

(it navigates away from SD queue view)

This seems to be happening on JIRA 6 as well as JIRA 7.
fields.summary: Changing attachment options in SD redirects to JIRA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44107].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

When JIRA receives a mail to create issue from another JIRA instance, having X-JIRA-FingerPrint prevents JIRA to create issue and throws the below error in the logs:
{code}
Received message with another JIRA instance's fingerprint
{code}
For more detailed information you can refer to:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/JIRA+Email+Finger+Print


h3. Suggested Solution
To enable the administrator to have an option to be able to create issues. However, this might lead to loop issues.


(!) This feature is to avoid loop and loop detection so we do not recommend to enable it, unless we get Atlassian Development Team idea about it.

(!) Do note that Atlassian do not support customization as described on the documentation as outlined in our Atlassian Support Offerings. Please only try if you are confident on doing so and we strongly encourage customers to perform the check on test environment first before applying to production.

Explanation By Customer(In the comments):
{quote}
The increasing number of JIRA instances, and how we'd like them to work together, raises an interesting use case for us:
Desired Outcome
What we'd like to do is create issues in our JIRA instance from another organisation's JIRA emails to us. We can't do that because our JIRA handler detects these emails as correctly belonging to another JIRA instance.
Steps:
Organisation A (OrgA) and Organisation B (OrgB) both have their own JIRA instances.
OrgA sends support request email to OrgB
OrgB JIRA mail handler detects email and creates issue (Issue Key ORGB-1)
OrgB sends JIRA issue notification to OrgA
OrgA JIRA mail handler detects email and create issue (Issue Key ORGA-1)
OrgA JIRA local users / groups can use ORGA-1 to track issue progress with OrgB without needing access to OrgB JIRA.
Actual Outcome
Organisation A (OrgA) and Organisation B (OrgB) both have their own JIRA instances.
Steps:
OrgA sends support request email to OrgB
OrgB JIRA mail handler detects email and creates issue (Issue Key ORGB-1)
OrgB sends JIRA issue notification to OrgA
OrgA JIRA mail handler detects email from OrgB and rejects it with the following error in the logs: "Received message with another JIRA instance's fingerprint"
No issue is created in OrgA JIRA.
This would be extremely useful because it allow users or user groups issue visibility and tracking with issues lodged with another organisation's JIRA.
{quote}
fields.summary: To Be Able to Create Issues By JIRA Mail Handler Fingerprint
Putting "inltokxyzkdtnhgnsbdfinltok0inltokxyzkdtnhgnsbdfinltok" in a block renders an issue unshowable

h5. Summary
In JIRA Status translation page, when user selects the language German, it translates Status to Statuses instead of Status as the word remains the same.

h5. Steps to reproduce
- Go to user profile and set preferred language to "Deutshland"
- Go to Status translation page
-* You will notice that the word statuses says statuses in German instead of "Status" as both singular and plural for this word are the same.
-* Also the word need to be written ucfirst.

Can this be changed.
fields.summary: Wrong Translation in JIRA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44091].
  {panel}

Creating issue with 
"Unicode Character 'LINE SEPARATOR' (U+2028)" in summary breaks issue searcher.
*Steps to reproduce:*
1. go to some page eg. issues->search for issues
2. click create button to create new issue
3. paste text with u+2028 character eg. "Make Payments for sessions  "
the quoted text should have this character at the end, You can check this by going to ge. http://www.url-encode-decode.com/ and encode the string, the output string should have %E2%80%A8 near the end.
4. create issue
5. go back to eg. dashboard
6. return to issues->search for issues
7. the page is broken due to failing JS

after investigation it turned out that the culprit is the old jquery library that we use (i belive 1.7.2) and there is some json string matching there that the string with unicode new line character fails
{code}
var Yb=/^(?:\{.*\}|\[.*\])$/
{code}
and later 
{code}
c="true"===c?!0:"false"===c?!1:"null"===c?null:d.isNumeric(c)?+c:Yb.test(c)?d.parseJSON(c):c
{code}
that fails and returns string instead of parsed json object.

the workaround is to edit specific issue and delete these "invalid" character.
fields.summary: creating issue with utf8 new line character (U+2028) in summary breaks issue search page

This used to work alright till a few days ago - so I suspect its due to some changes in the Key auto-detection or so. The issue can be seen in the following line using the attached picture.

!testbugpic_JRA-28590_filename.jpg.jpg|thumbnail!
fields.summary: If an uploaded image contains an issue key, it does not get rendered in Comments or Description

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44085].
  {panel}

When I click the "create" button in the JIRA Create Issue dialog I often leave the tab to do other things because it takes so long.

When I come back to the tab, there is no information about what has happened while I was away. Often the issue is created but there is no indication on the tab in question that this has happened. The way that I discover the fact that the issue was created is by navigating to my provide and looking there.

I have attached a video of this in action.

I had time to open a video capture session while waiting on JIRA to finish creating an issue…
fields.summary: No information on what happened after clicking create on create issue dialog

fields.description:

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44078].
  {panel}

In one of our environment we we need to use SSL and termination of SSL should happened on Tomcat (Jira). 

We can't use apache/nginx/haproxy/etc.

As I can see in the link - https://bz.apache.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=53952

The possibility has been added in tomcat-7.0.57 but at the same time Jira-6.4.6 comes with tomcat-7.0.55. And that's a problem.

It would be great if Tomcat 7.0.57 is supported by JIRA
fields.summary: Tomcat 7.0.57 to be supported by JIRA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44068].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

As a Project Manager, its not possible to see all groups in the drop down list if there are more than 20 (i.e. showing 20 of 40 matching groups).

For example, if there is a group called Legal, you won't see it in the list and it will only be selectable by typing "L". However, this only works if you already know the name of the group that are is to be selected.

h3. Suggested Solution

Allow the Project Manager to browse the groups or search by wildcard
fields.summary: As a Project Manager, I Need to See All Groups When Adding Permissions at the Group Level

When viewing a dashboard JIRA presents this message: "This dashboard is not available in your Dashboard menu. To add it to the Dashboard menu, you need to add it as a favorite on the Manage Dashboards page."

h3. Environment
Server / Cloud

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44054].
  {panel}

At the moment, The following information is audited by JIRA:
* user management
* group management
* project changes
* permission changes
* workflow changes
* notification scheme changes
* custom field changes
* component changes
* version changes

It would be great to have *add-ons changes* information (for example disabling/enabling add-ons) in the Audit Log.
fields.summary: Include Add-ons changes information in Audit Log

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44053].
  {panel}

In Jira we would like to change the order of which Status buttons that appears on the issues (see attached image Status buttons in worng order.png).

I saw that the <tt>opsbar-sequence</tt> could be the key. The guide below does not work as you are not allowed to enter the <tt>-tags in the property field.
https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/145963/is-it-possible-to-change-the-order-of-workflow-steps-in-the-issue-view

When that did not work I found the following guide, but when using the opsbar-sequence with values 100, 200, and so on the Status buttons still comes in wrong order (see image Property config.PNG).
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Advanced+Workflow+Configuration#Advancedworkflowconfiguration-customisingtransitionsonviewissue

How can we change the order of the Status buttons in Jira On-Demand?

Best Regards
/Hazze Molin

ps. Also I still cannot find the current On-Demand version to enter in the Affects Version field when submitting this bug request. ds.
fields.summary: Not possible to Change the order of Status buttons in Jira On-Demand
Make the process of adding a dashboard to favorites more simple.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44045].
  {panel}

There is no way to add watchers while creating a ticket; that's a pretty big shortfall.

To add insult to injury, after entering a new ticket, instead of showing the ticket so you can then add the watchers, only a small banner appears. If you don't click on it fast enough, you have to then search for your ticket, just to add the watchers.

As a developer of systems myself, it would appear to be trivial to collect the watcher ids in a form, post together with the new ticket data, and map the watchers after the ticket is created.

Even more trivially, just redirect to the newly created ticket. This is the standard pattern for any CRUD system, and you're completely breaking it. I read that support teams want this so they can create a ticket without changing their current screen.

OK. then add a checkbox at the bottom of the create ticket screen that defaults to 'Open ticket after creation'. 1 new element, 2 lines of code, 1 extra test.

I also see that there are a lot of complaints about this spanning the last 2 years (really!?) such that there is even a JS plugin hack to get around this unintuitive behaviour.

How hard can that be? About 15 minutes of work?

C'mon guys!
fields.summary: Open ticket after creation or allow watchers to be added when creating ticket
Request ability to paste an html table into Jira comment and description
Magnifyng glass icon should be clickable on Quick Search field

fields.description:

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44036].
  {panel}

At the moment, in JIRA, you can only display a message on contact administrators form when the form is enabled. No message is shown when the form is disabled.

As an admin, I would like to add a message in there (for example with an email address asking the users to send an email instead). Currently I am not able to do that without customising the interface.


*Workaround*
* Use JIRA Announcement banner to display the message on a particular screen
* or alternatively, you can enable contact administrator form and then use javascript in the announcement banner to hide the form and just display the message.
fields.summary: As an administrator, I would need to show text even when Contact Administrators form is disabled

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44026].
  {panel}

*Summary:* 
_Default Issue Type_ parameter within the Issue Type Scheme, is being ignored for users who have created an issue in the same session.

*Steps to Reproduce:*
# Create two projects.
# Create a new Issue Type schemes and associate one with each project.
# Set the Default Issue Type to New Feature (anything other than the default one).
# Click on "Create" the create an issue, choose different Issue Type other that the one that was set to the Default Issue Type.
# Click on "Cancel" to cancel creating issue.
# Click on "Create" the create an issue and the Default Issue Type does not work anymore.

*Expected Results:*
Default Issue Type should be selected.

*Actual Results:*
The previously selected Issue Type is selected.

*Notes:*
I found a related issue JRA-24439 which was closed.
fields.summary: Default Issue Type is being ignored

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44025].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
At the General Configuration page, if Allow Gravatars set to OFF , the user avatars will not be displayed in the email notification.

The gravatar need to be set to OFF as then only the "first initial" avatars will be visible on the Agile Board.

*With Allow Gravatars set to OFF*
!initial2.png|thumbnail!

*With Allow Gravatars set to ON*
!initial1.png|thumbnail!

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to General Configuration
# Allow Gravatars set to OFF
# Update and issue so a notification would be sent

h3. Expected Results
Either should be showing the default avatar or the "first initial" avatars
!gravatar-on.png|thumbnail!

h3. Actual Results
Shows blank
!gravatar-off.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Avatar does not display in email notification when Allow Gravatars is set to OFF

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44017].
  {panel}

h4. +Usage Clarification+
In [JIRA 6.4 Release Notes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/JIRA+6.4+Release+Notes], under "Click here to read about more JIRA 6.4 features..", it's stated that:
bq. *Paste images* - Previously if you had an attachment or image on your clipboard, you had to save it and add it to a JIRA comment or description as an attachment. Now, you can simply copy it directly to JIRA by using your keyboard shortcut or selecting "Copy" from the right-click menu.

It's not clear which places are covered by "JIRA comment or description" and "copy it directly to JIRA". *Suggestion* is to make it clear that:
{panel}
# Keyboard shortcut can be used to directly paste an image from clipboard to:
#* the Description field in the View Issue screen only (Inline-Edit is required)
#* the Comment field expanded by clicking on the Comment button (either top or bottom) in the View Issue screen only
# Keyboard shortcut can't be used for:
#* Description or Comment field in a pop-up screen e.g. Create, Edit, or Transition screens
#* Attach Files or Log Work dialog
# Keyboard shortcut can still be used for Attach Screenshots dialog as usual
{panel}

h4. +Usage Improvement+
Other than that, when point 1 above is utilized, the following behaviors are observed:
# upon using Keyboard shortcut e.g. Ctrl+V, Attach Screenshots dialog is popped up to attach the pasted image
# once done, a wiki image link is automatically added to the field in focus, Description or Comment, in this format: {{\!screenshot-1.png!}}

This is not so helpful as it will render the whole big screenshot, and users will usually have to manually insert {{|thumbnail}} to have the image rendered as thumbnail.

*Suggestion*: the wiki image link should be added as {{\!screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!}}
fields.summary: Clarify usage of Paste Images and Improve its usage
Mention Confluence Links in "Clone Issue" documentation
REST API issueLink should not accept jira_subtask_link type

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44014].
  {panel}

When viewing an overview of Versions, users will be able to view the version in the Issue Navigator
!version.png|thumbnail!

When redirected to the Issue Navigator, we can see that the search is using ID's instead of Names
!issuenav.png|thumbnail!

It would be great if this uses Names instead of ID's. This is so users who open multiple tabs can easily distinguish which project/version their search is on.
fields.summary: Use Names instead of IDs when viewing versions in Issue Navigator

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44010].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Description
Importing backup into from JIRA Cloud to JIRA Server fails

h3. Environment
Cloud backup generated on 2015/06/24 (JIRA-backup-20150624)

h3. Expected Behavior 
Restore process should be successful from Cloud XML back to JIRA Server

h3. Actual Behavior 

Restore process fails with the below error in the UI
{code}
The file you are trying to import is from JIRA 6.5-OD-07-005, which is newer than your current version of JIRA and will not work. The import file claims it can be successfully imported into JIRA 6.3.12 or later.

If JIRA 6.3.12 is not yet available for download, please contact support.
{code}

!importerror.png|thumbnail!

This might be due to change of downgrade logic in 6.4.6.

h3. Workaround 

Try to restore the XML back up from the Cloud on fresh copy of JIRA 6.4.5
Enter the license when you restore it on JIRA 6.4.5
!JIRA_645_workaround .png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Importing JIRA Cloud to JIRA Server 6.4.7 Fails

fields.description:

  {panel}

JQL always show email address of user even though I set "User email visibility" as "Hidden" or "Masked"

Steps:
1. Go to "General Configuration" of JIRA
2. Select "Hidden" for "User email visibility" setting and save it
3. Go to do issue search in JIRA 

Actual behavior:
It displays email address of user. (attachment)

Expected behavior:
Email address of user in JQL should be respected as setting in General Configuration (hidden in this case).
fields.summary: JQL search doesn't respect JIRA setting for "User email visibility"
